result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Ray Goforth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:19 pm.  DA Gill, Atty Yang, and Mr. Goforth appeared.  Defendant enters plea of "guilty".  Court accepts plea entered freely, voluntarily and knowingly.  
Court orders defendant sentenced to 20 days in the Lafayette County Jail with work release commencing 3/16/17 by 6:00 pm concurrent to any other 
sentence defendant may be serving.  Defentant may have Huber priviliges.    Defendant shall pay court costs.  Defendant requests payment plan.
NOH
